item.title: Dog fouling, 1st February
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am making a formal complaint regarding persistent and ongoing dog fouling in our street within the Royal Borough of Greenwich. This problem has been continuous and has not been resolved through routine cleansing. Dog waste is repeatedly being left on pavements and verges, creating an unsanitary and unsafe environment for residents and pedestrians. The ongoing nature of this issue indicates a clear lack of deterrence and enforcement. I am therefore requesting immediate action in the form of: • Installation of clear and visible dog fouling signage stating that failure to clean up after dogs is an offence and may result in a fixed-penalty notice, and • Targeted enforcement measures to address repeat offending in this location. Without visible signage and enforcement, this behaviour will continue unchecked. Residents should not be expected to tolerate ongoing environmental health issues caused by a small number of irresponsible dog owners. Please confirm what action will be taken, including timescales for signage installation and any enforcement measures planned. Yours faithfully Nanu
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coldbath Street, Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous wall at risk of collapse, 1st February
item.description:
Denbigh Corner is the property on the corner of Clifford Avenue and Denbigh Close. It has a garden wall running down Denbigh Close, and about halfway down is a massive crack and the wall appears to be at risk of collapse. Myself and a number of other parents have children at Babington House and we walk along this street twice daily, having parked further up Denbigh Close. It is really concerning that the wall could collapse given all the kids that walk this way. We have knocked on the door of the house to try to speak with the owners but there is no reply.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Denbigh Close, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unclaimed bin, 1st February
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am reporting persistent fly-tipping at Coldbath Street, as shown in the attached photograph. An unauthorised wheelie bin has been left at this location for approximately three months and has become a focal point for ongoing illegal dumping of waste. The continued presence of this bin is directly contributing to the problem and has resulted in repeated accumulation of rubbish in the surrounding area. This is now a sustained environmental and public-health issue rather than a one-off incident. I require the following actions to be taken: • Removal of the unauthorised bin from the Coldbath Street location, and • Erection of clear signage stating that CCTV is in operation and that fixed-penalty notices may be issued for fly-tipping. Without these measures, the site will continue to attract illegal dumping. Prompt action is needed to prevent further misuse of the area. Please confirm when the bin will be removed and what enforcement or deterrent measures will be put in place. Yours faithfully, Nanu

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Conington Road, Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes across junction, 1st February
item.description:
